messageBody:
> 1) Why Junit framework should be written because as
> the developers many time is given for coding and junit
> takes much time.


From "Testing object oriented systems", V. Binder (explaining to his
daughter why his book (more than 1,000 pages) was so big)

"Testing is complicated and I'm an engineer. Making sure tht things work
right if very important for engineers. [...] So when engineers build
something or answer a question about how to build things, we have to be
sure we're right. We have to be sure nothing is left out. It takes a lot
of work."


> 2) what junit is doing? it compares the expected with
> actual but this can be done manualy


the goal of automated testing is to remove the "manually" from the
software engineer's vocabulary. From the same book, page 803: "Manual
testing is error-prone and tedious. In contracst, an automated test
suite will never be distracted by a phone call, type the wrong input, or
miss one incorrect character in 10,000 lines of output". JUnit is a
framework that help you (and all your co-workers) to create an automated
testing environment.

> since each
> developer will be doing this in its development
> routine


the developers should all use the same testing framework

> 3) When i have to get input from the konsole


separate the input (console) from the core application (what you're
doing with this information). Treat your console like an input class
that uses your core business module.

> because it cannot ale to give the relut value becuse

separate the business (calculation of the suite) from the output (the
display).
